item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "The farther backward you can look, the farther forward you are likely to see." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Daniel Patrick Moynihan
item.description: "Everyone is entitled to his own opinion, but not to his own facts." -- Daniel Patrick Moynihan

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Everything must be made as simple as possible. But not simpler." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Winston Churchill
item.description: "How dreadful are the curses which Mohammedanism lays on its votaries! Besides the fanatical frenzy, which is as dangerous in a man as hydrophobia in a dog, there is this fearful fatalistic apathy. The effects are apparent in many countries. Improvident habits, slovenly systems of agriculture, sluggish methods of commerce, and insecurity of property exist wherever the followers of the Prophet rule or live. A degraded sensualism deprives this life of its grace and refinement; the next of its dignity and sanctity. The fact that in Mohammedan law every woman must belong to some man as his absolute property – either as a child, a wife, or a concubine – must delay the final extinction of slavery until the faith of Islam has ceased to be a great power among men. Thousands become the brave and loyal soldiers of the faith: all know how to die but the influence of the religion paralyses the social development of those who follow it. No stronger retrograde force exists in the world. Far from being moribund, Mohammedanism is a militant and proselytizing faith. It has already spread throughout Central Africa, raising fearless warriors at every step; and were it not that Christianity is sheltered in the strong arms of science, the science against which it had vainly struggled, the civilisation of modern Europe might fall, as fell the civilisation of ancient Rome." -- Winston Churchill

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by John Wayne
item.description: "Life's hard. It's even harder when you're stupid." -- John Wayne

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Thomas A. Edison
item.description: "There are no rules here -- we're trying to accomplish something." -- Thomas A. Edison

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Jeffrey E. Garten
item.description: "A vision without execution is an hallucination." -- Jeffrey E. Garten

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Thomas A. Edison
item.description: "Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up." -- Thomas A. Edison

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Thomas A. Edison
item.description: "We often miss opportunity because it's dressed in overalls and looks like work" -- Thomas A. Edison

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The difference between genius and stupidity is; genius has its limits." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Anyone who has never made a mistake has never tried anything new." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Creativity is knowing how to hide your sources" -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If we knew what it was we were doing, it would not be called research, would it?" -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "A clever person solves a problem. A wise person avoids it." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "Somewhere, something incredible is waiting to be known." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Winston Churchill
item.description: "All of the great empires of the future will be empires of the mind." -- Winston Churchill

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "I am fond of pigs. Dogs look up to us. Cats look down on us. Pigs treat us as equals." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "There is more to life than simply increasing its speed." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "To give pleasure to a single heart by a single act is better than a thousand heads bowing in prayer." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I didn't have time to write a short letter, so I wrote a long one instead." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "You can never solve a problem on the level on which it was created." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Jeffrey add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "Before you become too entranced with gorgeous gadgets and mesmerizing video displays, let me remind you that information is not knowledge, knowledge is not wisdom, and wisdom is not foresight. Each grows out of the other, and we need them all." -- Arthur C. Clarke
